topic.title: Just so you know...
topic.body:
Yo mama's so fat, she needs a zipcode to locate her anus.

Thank you for joining ZeroNet.
bitmaster

topic.title: New site: 1 file update failed
topic.body: I created a new empty site (1EPXjkL94tmDvU1EWBiW55dBj8oJrGjjbo). It almost immediately got a few peers. All looked well. Then I made some small changes to content.json and index.html, just to give it a proper name and one line of content saying it's under construction. After updating I now keep getting a "1 FILE UPDATE FAILED" message, and just can't seem to debug it. The debug logs give me no clear information regarding this problem, which really sucks. How do I fix this?

1_19vYZ3YDA3LLxrhk3kSo58p2EppqkJVDMZ.body: Can you write "site" instead of "zite"? I see it a lot and it looks really weird. The rest of the English you get quite right. :)

> [kaffie](#comment_493_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): 'Zite' is used as a short way of writing 'zeronet site'. It appears the hivemind has reached a consensus on the term. And indeed there was a poll about it a while back.

Then I feel a bit noobified, sorry. Thanks!

2_14Kakxw14Eo5mXozLpsU755yeQuPmLRS9z.body:
I thought each seed has an exact copy of the site and is therefore hosting it? I guess I'm wrong then.
Anyway, I did "Check files" several times yesterday, and it didn't help. Funny enough, I did it again just now, and it worked. So right now it's fixed, although it took a long time and I don't know what caused it.
By "seed" I meant "peer" of course... (torrenting much? :P)

4_1AqXhGEgfmdaUUsvNp3GL9pueqqLbHMkXp.body: What do you mean, nothing works? That's bullshit. KODI works just fine. If your addons break, blame the addons.
